intro: Apalatoa spicata, commonly known as the spiky broom, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, bright yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are typically opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly hairy texture. Apalatoa spicata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant flowers and compact growth habit.
